results.title: Across the Strait
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
The Cape Barren goose one of the world’s rarest species, is found on the island in Bass Strait. Looks at the birds in their natural environment and describes their varying fortunes at the hands of man. Other birds filmed include Pacific gulls, cormorants, black swans, the chestnut teal and the spur-winged plover also emphasising research by Dr. Dorward on Glennie Island.

results.title: Against the escarpment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
A view of wildlife, mainly birds, in natural surroundings in Arnhem Land. Includes a discussion of threats to the ecological balance. Birds shown include the black banded pigeon, brolga, ibis, pygmy and magpie geese

results.title: The Seal watch with Bob Warneke
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
This film, taken at the height of the breeding season of the seals in the Bass Strait, records the annual out-haul of the 800 lb weight territorial males and their violent battles for breeding territory. Included is the birth of a seal pup and a description of the challenges to its survival. Cinematography by Keith Taylor.
results.description:

results.title: The Diminishing rain forest
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Shows the wildlife in an Australian tropical forest and how it survives natural devastation but not the influence of man. Contains footage of John Olsen paintings. Commentary by Douglas Dorward.

results.brief_description:

results.title: Beyond the dune
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Depicts birdlife on the salt lagoons of the Coorong, S.A., including banded stilts, cormorants and dotterels. Includes a longer study of the colony of pelicans on Pelican Island, especially the play behaviour and feeding of fledglings. John Olsen’s paintings are featured also in this documentary. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.

Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Above the gorge
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Studies of the Wedge-tailed eagle, Australia’s largest bird, on the Nullarbor Plain in Western Australia, where CSIRO scientists are researching the life-cycle of the eagle, and in Western Victoria where it is regarded as an efficient controller of rabbits. Cinematographer: Keith Taylor.
